Description: Shoulder fragment of South Ionian Middle Wild Goat II pottery oinochoe (?); interior reserved; exterior, cream slip: part of a sphinx to left on thin ground line with thick band of dark brown glaze with added red stripe below; remains of a bird's tail(?) to the left of sphinx; filling ornaments: triangle, rosette, quatrefoil and quartered lozenge; added red on shoulder, wing-covert and body of sphinx. Drill hole from sampling for clay analysis in broken edge.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Dimensions: Circumference: 42 centimetres (on outside just below main decorated zone)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.056)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.11)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
